channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for CA

item.title: Report X-2024021016
item.description:
Report X-2024021016

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: CHINO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: There was a call from the load side for a leaking hazmat. QA arrived on the scene and noticed the package was slightly damp and there was some moisture where the package had been sitting for a few minutes. Absorbant was placed over the wet area, and the package was placed in a tote lined with a bag. DescribePack: There was a defect in one of the caps which caused a slow leak. DurationRel: 0 and MitigateEffect: Absorbant was placed over the affected area.

item.title: Report E-2024020388
item.description:
Report E-2024020388

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-08
  • City: W SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On February 8, 2024, one (1) 5-gallon pail of UN1263 was damaged due to a load shift and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Patriot Environmental Services (PES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and worked them in with hand tools. Cleaners and absorbent pads were utilized to remove any residual product. The damaged pail, all UN1263 impacted materials, and spent absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal

item.title: Report X-2024021025
item.description:
Report X-2024021025

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-21T15:11:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-09
  • City: NEWARK
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: 1. X-2024021025 SequenceEvent: Package was located inside the trailer and smoke was coming from it I was called to retrieve the package and inspected, package was wet and when inspected it was found that the bottle was leaking from the bottom. DescribePack: bottle was cracked at the bottom. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PPE was brought to contain the package in a hazmat bag and a tote after I cleaned the area and took another package that was leaked on or damage. 2. X-2024021114 SequenceEvent: Three of twenty identical HazMat packages were reported leaking when being unloaded at station. Of the seventeen that were assessed and determined to be unaffected and sent OFD, two more developed leaks in transit, affecting in all ten packages. These packages were transferred from the van they were on to be brought back to station for processing, along with the other seven, refused by recipient due to exposure to the leakage incident. DescribePack: Internal bottle cracked at edge of base. Crack was visually about a half inch in length, though it was only leaking from a section of the crack. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Affected packages were removed from original van and returned to station. Unknown what other packages were aboard van that continued on its route. 3. X-2024021226 SequenceEvent: Package was inside the trailer wet and was called for an inspection and was found that one of the bottles was leaking from the bottom as it was cracked. DescribePack: Small crack at the bottom of the bottle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was put into a hazmat bag and a tote and then taken into the hazmat area as well as the area where the leak happened was cleaned up.

item.title: Report X-2024020604
item.description:
Report X-2024020604

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-23
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Exterior Packaging was soaking wet on all sides and has a strong chemical scent when it was submitted in a plastic lined container. DescribePack: Inner package had a black rubber tape around the cap, but it was loose of around a quarter of a turn. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Any spill was wiped with an absorbent pad and submitted the package in a plastic lined container.

item.title: Report X-2024020794
item.description:
Report X-2024020794

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-08
  • City: SAN DIEGO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: THE PACKAGE WAS FOUND UNDER THE TOWERS, WHICH THE BOX WAS WET AND SPILLING LIQUID, IT WAS PUT INSIDE A BAG TO AVOID SPILLING, THEN IT WAS INSPECTED TO DEDUCT THE CAUSE OF THE DAMAGE AND BE ABLE TO PROCESS THE DAMAGE REPORT. DescribePack: IT APPEARS THE BOX HAD A BROKEN LID DUE TO THE PACKAGE WAS DROPPED DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: IT WAS PUT INSIDE A HAZMAT TOTE AS THE LIQUID WAS FOUND AS HAZMAT. TO AVOID ANY CONTACT AND AVOID ANY ACCIDENT.

item.title: Report X-2024020666
item.description:
Report X-2024020666

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-16T15:14:16+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-25
  • City: CITY OF INDUSTRY
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was found leaking in the unload 1. The package was placed in a proper hazmat bag and the floor/rollers were cleaned of the liquid that spilled out. DescribePack: Upon opening the box, it was viewed that the cap and plastic seals that close the liquid inside the container were loose. One container was slightly open, so it caused the internal leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill was cleaned up properly and the leaking hazmat was taken to the hazmat cage to be processed.

We contained the leaking box using PPE gear and put in a Hazmat bin for inspection. DescribePack: The plastic bottle has a slit on the side middle. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: The package was put into Hazmat bag in a bin.

Item was removed from the sort stream and placed into a plastic lined container for inspection. DescribePack: The weld seams on both cans were cracked, approximate length of fracture was 1 cm. DurationRel: 4 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up using absorbent materials. The rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container and removed from the discovery site.

item.title: Report I-2023120049
item.description:
Report I-2023120049

Identified by scraper @ 2024-02-22T15:12:23+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-14
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED AIRLINES HOLDINGS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: A can of flammable liquid had fell over off the belt loader unto the ground and the spill surrounded the Power Stow belt loader. The SOC notified the Fire Department to evaluate the situation. The GSE Team covered the spill with sand to keep the spill contained around the Power Stow and the Fire Department cleared the GSE Team to clean up the spill. No injury to anyone.
